amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) by $900,000, with the intent to obligate that $900,000 to the Firefighter Cancer Registry within NIOSH and offset this increase by reducing General Departmental Management funding for the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) by $900,000.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 16 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to increase FY20 funding for the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) by $900,000, with the intent to obligate that $900,000 to the Firefighter Cancer Registry within NIOSH and offset this increase by reducing General Departmental Management funding for the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) by $900,000.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Pascrell amendment (A016) Agreed to by recorded vote: 413 - 10 (Roll no. 262).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Pascrell amendment (A016) Agreed to by recorded vote: 413 - 10 (Roll no. 262).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A016) offered by Mr. Pascrell.
